gov.usgs.anss.util

Class PNZ

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.PNZ

  • public final class PNZ
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent a Poles and Zeros as commonly used in seismology. When used with RESP files for SEED usage a0 is normally that defined in the SEED manual. WHen this is used to represent a "cooked" response it is the gain value (sensitivity) in units like counts/nm.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PNZ()
      create an empty PNZ - no poles are zeros and a0, sensitivity of 1, units are unknown.
      PNZ(java.lang.String pnztext)
      Creates a new instance of PNZ from text in resp form or text from stasrv form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PNZ

        public PNZ()
        create an empty PNZ - no poles are zeros and a0, sensitivity of 1, units are unknown. Normally there should be a call to setUnits() to set the units and resolved units.

        Parameters:
        pnztext - Text for PNZ section in RESP or in stasrv form

      • getResolvedUnits

        public java.lang.String getResolvedUnits()
        return a string with the units from the seed volume. The encoding is first character 'A'cceleration, 'V'elocity, 'D' displacement, 'U'ndefined. The second character if present gives the units of distance. No 2nd character is Meters, 'n' is nanometers iF the units are not recognized
        Returns:
        The SEED unit

      • getUnits

        public java.lang.String getUnits()
        return a string with the units from the seed volume
        Returns:
        The SEED unit

        multiple PNZ can be combined by adding the zeros and poles up and adjusting the a0
        Parameters:
        pz - the PNZ to combine with this one

      • convertFromBtoA

        public final void convertFromBtoA()
        The B type response is just the formulation where t(f) = A0*sens*(prod(f-zeros))/prod(f-poles). We need to convert to the formulation for a A type by multiplying each pole and zero by 2Pi and adjusting the constant by a compensating amount.

      • getResponse

        public Complex getResponse(double f)
        return the response value as a complex. A0 is the scale factor to multiply the ratio of the products of the zeros/poles.
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles)

      • getAmp

        public double getAmp(double f)
        return the amplitude portion of the response at given frequency
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response modulus(a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))

      • getPhase

        public double getPhase(double f)
        return the phase portion of the response at given frequency in degrees
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        The complex response atax2(imag(resp)/real(resp)) converted to degrees

      • getA0

        public final double getA0(double f)
        Calculate the value of a0 as presented by SEED from the poles and zeros. That is 1./modulus(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        a0 value per seed =1./modulus(a0* prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles))

      • getA0Phase

        public double getA0Phase(double f)
        Calculate the value phase in degrees as presented by SEED from the poles and zeros. That is ans=(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles)), return is atan2(imag(ans), real(ans) in degrees.
        Parameters:
        f - The frequency in Hz at which the response is desired.
        Returns:
        phase(a0) value per seed atan2(imag(prod(s-zeros)/prod(s-poles),real(...)))
